title: 106_hr3147
content: Section 1 of the document amends various sections of title 5, United States Code, by changing the maximum pay levels from "level IV" to "level II" for different positions. This includes Members of the Senior Executive Service, positions covered by Section 5376, Contract Appeals Board Members, positions covered by Section 5373, and positions covered by Section 5306. The document amends Section 5304(g)(2) of title 5, United States Code, by changing the reference from "level III of the Executive Schedule" to "the annual rate of salary under section 104 of title 3." Additionally, it amends Section 5307 by adding a new subsection (b)(1) that modifies the application of subsection (a) for certain employees. The document amends Section 5304(g)(2) of title 5, United States Code, by changing the reference from "level III of the Executive Schedule" to "the annual rate of salary under section 104 of title 3." It also amends Section 5307 by adding a new subsection (b)(1) that modifies the application of subsection (a) for certain employees, including those in specific positions such as the Senior Executive Service, Federal Bureau of Investigation, Drug Enforcement Administration Senior Executive Service, and others in senior-level positions. The document makes amendments to various sections of title 5, United States Code, including changing references and adding new subsections to modify the application for certain employees in senior-level positions. Amendments include changing references in sections 5307(d), 3152, and 5383(b) of title 5, United States Code. SEC. 3. Establishes examiners-in-chief and designated examiners-in-chief roles in the Patent and Trademark Office. Amendments are made to the basic pay rates for Examiners-in-chief and Designated examiners-in-chief in the Patent and Trademark Office, changing the reference to the rate of basic pay payable for level II of the Executive Schedule. Additionally, changes are made to locality-based comparability payments in title 5 of the United States Code. Amendments are made to basic pay rates for Examiners-in-chief and Designated examiners-in-chief in the Patent and Trademark Office, including changes to locality-based comparability payments in title 5 of the United States Code. This involves redesignating subparagraphs, inserting new positions, and making conforming amendments to sections 5304(g)(2)(A) and 5304(h)(2)(B)(i) of title 5, United States Code.
